item.title: use systemv manager the auto boot script and servcie
item.description: Init scripts are typically stored in the /etc/init.d/ directory and are started using the init process, which is the first process started by the Linux kernel. Write the init script with systemv style cat /etc/init.d/demo-service 1#!/usr/bin/env bash 2 3### BEGIN INIT INFO 4# Provides: restore-iptables 5# Required-Start: 6# Required-Stop: 7# Default-Start: 2 3 4 5 8# Default-Stop: 0 1 6 9# Short-Description: load iptables rule when reboot 10# Description: Automation restore the iptables rule from file, when system is reboot.
